 it!  *RIP* Spike opens package. Jet: RRRRRRRRRR!!!!! Spike: Hmm?

BOO YAA!=
 I LOVE IT!
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Abyssian Badass 
  To: =
nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, October 29, 2001 3:16 PM
  Subject:=
 Re: 2


  OOC: May I suggest Cowboy Bebop? Excellent Anime, excellent, yes=
. Well, I note that Dragon Ball Z has one MAJOR flaw. The English version. =
Yep, that's right, the English version. Do yourself a favor and get yoursel=
f subtitled Japanese versions of it, it wasn't, and isn't anything like the=
 English version...

    ----- Original Message -----
    From: Kyle Stewar=
t
    To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
    Sent: Monday, October 29, 2001 11:38 A=
M
    Subject: Re: 2

ves to

    --- robertdahl <rdahl@...> wrote:
 =
   > Alloran is right about RID, and all the other
    > things. Gobots was=
 a rival
    > show, about the same, but it didnt have no where
    > near =
the impact with
    > storyline, or creating a whole universe. Their toys
 =
   > were quite inferior,
    > and eventually Hasbro put them out of buisn=
ess, then
    > bought the rights
    > to it. That's why for a while in Ge=
neration 2 they
    > had characters named
    > Gobot, it was a shot in th=
e face.
    > 
    > I would have liked to see the Beast Wars that the
    =
> writers would have
    > made if they had total control and an unlimited
=
    > budget. In my opinion
    > the guys who wrote that show were geniuse=
s.
    > 
    > I like RID, but I am not to fond of how Anime it is.
    > =
I'm not a big fan
    > of Japanese cartoons, and this one is no exeption,
=
    > it dosent take itself
    > seriously. The animation is beautiful how=
ever, but
    > the stories are not
    > very compeling. However I have re=
ad rumors that
    > Takara or Hasbro (i'm
    > not sure which one is the =
owner) will make a brand
    > new series soon
    > revolving around Gener=
ation 1, but this is just a
    > rumor.
